page.title: 14CHANGING TIMES
page.content: In{1945}there was still one shop. This was a grocer's shop. The water still came from the{natural spring } at Bolankan. There was still a blacksmith working in the village. Most of the people worked at Holman Foundry, Camborne, the Mill in Crowan and on the farms. There were lots of farms, some grew crops and some had animals. The village was the same size but some houses had been{modernised.}The school in Praze was about the same size as it is today. People got their milk in a can from the farm. There was still no electricity in the houses and people cooked on cornish ranges. The most popular vehicle was now{the car.} The only tin mine still working was Grenvilles at Troon. The modern day bus firm is named after this mine.
